column4: Hi all, i have 2 questions, 1) is linux source what i need to install if i need to build a kernel? 2) is there a way to set it up so that when ubuntu starts up the networking it set the media types on my ethernet card to 10baseT?
you better go find your local LUG, and get some step by step help
umm i can do the kernel install, done alot of them on this machine, i'm just new to ubuntu so i don't know the package names, and i have some semi broken hardware as for the network thing....
then you want linux-source packages
thank you, know anything about basicly doing an mii-tool -A 10BaseT eth0 in the startup scripts?
nope
kk
you could just spend 10 bucks and buy a new NIC that is well supported =)
it's a lappy, they want ~500USD for a new main board
ah... you could buy a usb nic =)
usb1.1... and it's a 5 year old box and my back up lappy not worth the money...
you can get a usb 1.1 nic for under $35 bucks i bet
i know, i have one =)
paypal me $33? :P
heh ,  r u that broke?
is there a package i need to install to get GCC/ld/etc?
what bimberi said
yea.. basicly, i'm in college and have a 4 month old son
